A **scroll of stinking cloud** is a type of [magical](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item") [scroll](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Identification](#Identification)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Messages](#Messages)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [5.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [5.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Description

.............  
....CCCCC....  
...CCCCCCC...  
..CCCCCCCCC..  
.CCCCCCCCCCC.  
.CCCCCCCCCCC.  
.CCCCC\@CCCCC.  
.CCCCCCCCCCC.

Spots you can center a stinking cloud on

...........  
...........  
.....#.....  
....###....  
...#####...  
..###C###..  
...#####...  
....###....  
.....#.....  
...........  
...........

cursed#/uncursed#/blessed# cloud size

When read, the scroll will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") and prompt you to select a square on the dungeon map; the scroll will attempt to center a cloud of [poison gas](/wiki/Poison_cloud "Poison cloud") around the chosen square, with its size and damage depending on the scroll's [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude"). The selected square must be visible and within a range of 5.6 tiles for the cloud to be successfully placed; selecting a square outside of this range will print a message and use up the scroll, with no other effect.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Blessed scrolls will create a larger cloud and do more damage; cursed scrolls give a smaller cloud and do less damage. Reading the scroll while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") does not change the effect.

| Scroll BUC | Damage before dissipation (for 4–6 turns) | Damage after 1st dissipation (for 2 turns) | Damage after 2nd dissipation (for 2 turns) | Cloud size |
| ---------- | ----------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------ | ---------- |
| Blessed    | 6–17                                      | 6–11                                       | 6–8                                        | 4×4        |
| Uncursed   | 6–13                                      | 6–9                                        | (cloud gone)                               | 3×3        |
| Cursed     | 6–9                                       | (cloud gone)                               | (cloud gone)                               | 2×2        |

The lifespan of the cloud is also dependent upon the beatitude of the scroll: the total lifespan of the cloud is 4–6 turns for a cursed scroll, 6–8 turns for an uncursed scroll and 8–10 turns for a blessed scroll. A cloud created by a non-cursed scroll will undergo a first dissipation, after which it will cause less damage; after two more turns, a cloud created by an uncursed scroll will disappear, while a cloud created by a blessed scroll will undergo a second dissipation, during which it will cause even less damage before eventually disappearing.

The area covered by a stinking cloud is represented by #[![Cloud.png](/images/d/d2/Cloud.png)](/wiki/File:Cloud.png) - monsters caught in the cloud (including [you](/wiki/You "You")) will take damage unless they are [nonliving](/wiki/Nonliving "Nonliving"), [unbreathing](/wiki/Unbreathing "Unbreathing") or have [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), and will be [blinded](/wiki/Blind "Blind") if they have eyes.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) Peaceful monsters caught in the poison gas will become hostile regardless of if they took damage from it. Monsters killed by a poison cloud created from a scroll you read count as being killed by you for purposes of benefits such as gaining experience, as well as applicable penalties including [murder](/wiki/Murder "Murder").[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## Strategy

Players who are unbreathing or poison resistant can use the scroll of stinking cloud to wipe out an entire crowd of surrounding monsters. Players can also use the scroll to target packed rooms like [treasure zoos](/wiki/Treasure_zoo "Treasure zoo") and [throne rooms](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room") and wipe out many monsters from a distance, with most of them being unable to move away from the cloud. This works especially well in [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios")'s throne room.

A stinking cloud can also be used to kill a shopkeeper from a safe distance, provided you are magic-resistant—the cloud should kill the shopkeeper before they use up their wands and come after you physically, all the while blinding them and forcing them to use up their [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion") of [healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing") or [extra healing](/wiki/Potion_of_extra_healing "Potion of extra healing") to un-blind themselves. The shopkeeper seems to stand still inside the cloud as long as they cannot see you.

### Identification

- *Main article: [Price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification")*

The scroll of stinking cloud is one of the safer 300zm scrolls to read when unidentified - at worst, you can direct the cloud far away from peaceful monsters or even select an invalid square to simply use up the scroll.

## History

The scroll of stinking cloud first appears in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Messages

- *Main article: [Poison cloud#messages](/wiki/Poison_cloud#messages "Poison cloud")*

- You smell rotten eggs.

  You read a scroll of stinking cloud and selected a spot that was too far away or not visible, using up the scroll.

## Variants

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), reading this scroll while confused will instead create a large number of [gas spores](/wiki/Gas_spore "Gas spore"). A confused reading of a blessed scroll will create 1-3 [dungeon fern](/wiki/Dungeon_fern "Dungeon fern") spores - these spores can grow into any of the 4 varieties of dungeon ferns depending on the type of terrain.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), demons known as [yochlols](/wiki/Yochlol "Yochlol") can transform into a [vortex](/wiki/Vortex "Vortex") monster also called a **stinking cloud**; being engulfed by the vortex has the same effects as being caught in a stinking cloud created by this scroll.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), stinking clouds from the scroll no longer use a predefined rhombus shape; instead, they expand from their origin point to fit the terrain, making them especially dangerous in closed spaces.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), monsters will read the scroll of stinking cloud, and hostile ones will use the cloud against you if you are in range.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/read.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 961](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/read.c#L961)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/region.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 971](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/region.c#L971)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/region.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 989](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/region.c#L989)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/region.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1018](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/region.c#L1018)
